posts.post_content:
The name reminds me of Lucretia Crescent from Final Fantasy VII.  
The artwork reminds me of the Evil Queen from Disney's Snow White.  
The stats remind me of [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp).  
  
That's three reasons to chuckle when seeing this card.
posts.html:
The name reminds me of Lucretia Crescent from Final Fantasy VII.
The artwork reminds me of the Evil Queen from Disney's Snow White.
The stats remind me of Chimney Imp.

That's three reasons to chuckle when seeing this card.

posts.post_content: Compare to [Radha, Heir to Keld](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Radha, Heir to Keld), another legendary creature who can tap for mana. It's more a sign of how far creatures have come, I suppose, but Radha's mana ability actually makes sense in light of her CMC. Ramping up from 2 is quite handy; ramping up from 6 is a bit silly, though.
posts.html:
Compare to Radha, Heir to Keld, another legendary creature who can tap for mana. It's more a sign of how far creatures have come, I suppose, but Radha's mana ability actually makes sense in light of her CMC. Ramping up from 2 is quite handy; ramping up from 6 is a bit silly, though.

posts.post_content:
WotC knew that people hated vanilla legends like [Jedit Ojanen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jedit Ojanen), so they thought, and thought, and thought, and thought.  
  
An hour later, one of the staff members said "F\*\*K it! Give it a mana-gaining ability!"  
Another said, "But wouldn't it be too costly to just get 1 mana for something that costs 6 converted mana?"  
The first replied, "Yeah, but who cares? The little bastrds are going to buy these cards anyway!"  
And the whole room erupted in a roar of laughter in their giant gothic castle while the music begins to play dramatically and lightning strikes down.  
  
  
What? Oh, don't look at me like that. That's totally what happened.
posts.html:
WotC knew that people hated vanilla legends like Jedit Ojanen, so they thought, and thought, and thought, and thought.

An hour later, one of the staff members said "F**K it! Give it a mana-gaining ability!"
Another said, "But wouldn't it be too costly to just get 1 mana for something that costs 6 converted mana?"
The first replied, "Yeah, but who cares? The little bastrds are going to buy these cards anyway!"
And the whole room erupted in a roar of laughter in their giant gothic castle while the music begins to play dramatically and lightning strikes down.


What? Oh, don't look at me like that. That's totally what happened.
